text:
Hi! I have a HubSpot website with a lot of pages that contains HubSpot Form module. We want to track the form submissions in Google Tag Manager. Do you know how I can add data layers to track the HubSpot forms?

I also looked at this link <https://medium.com/@dillonjones/the-easiest-way-to-setup-HubSpot-form-tracking-in-google-analytics-a8ad9ab1fc4d> . Does that mean that we actually only need to set it up on GTM with the snippet they included? Or have I misunderstood?
That article details the same approach I would take, yes. Global form event messages are a great solution for this use case.
Okay, thanks for responding! so then we dont need to add data layers at all in HubSpot? You just take care of everything in GTM?
Assuming GTM is installed on your site, then yes, adding it to GTM would put that script on every page, and using the global form events would dynamically tell you what form was submitted.
